feed.title: Integration Ninja Cats
feed.subtitle: Your central place to start your Microsoft+SAP integration journey and keep up to date with the latest community efforts.

entry.title: SAP & MS Teams 2 – Target application features

link.title: SAP & MS Teams 2 – Target application features

entry.summary: In the upcoming weeks, we will publish a blog post series that will get you up to speed on how to extend SAP business workflows into the Microsoft Azure ecosystem by developing your own Microsoft Teams extension application for SAP SuccessFactors. Whereas this sample scenario makes use of dedicated SAP and Microsoft Azure services, the presented approach opens a variety of new and exciting inte...

entry.title: Integrate SAP Cloud Portal and Launchpad Service into Microsoft Teams including SSO

link.title: Integrate SAP Cloud Portal and Launchpad Service into Microsoft Teams including SSO

entry.summary: Dear community, Integrating SAP PaaS services from Business Technology Platform (BTP) into other portal environments is still en vogue nowadays. So, here goes a short guide how to make it happen with SAP Cloud Portal (same for Launchpad service) and Microsoft Teams as an example for the approach.

entry.title: BTP private linky swear with Azure – connecting to PaaS DBs with Private Link Service

link.title: BTP private linky swear with Azure – connecting to PaaS DBs with Private Link Service

entry.summary: Dear community, Continuing with the implementation journey of BTP Private Link Service (PLS) we will have a closer look at latest PLS feature upgrade adding MySQL and MariaDB from the Azure PaaS portfolio.

entry.title: Building a Side-by-side Extension with Kyma and Microsoft Azure

link.title: Building a Side-by-side Extension with Kyma and Microsoft Azure

entry.summary: The topic of side-by-side extension is out now for quite a while in the SAP ecosystem, but the playfield changed a bit over the last years as some new players entered the field (e. g. a managed Kyma offering) and the combination (or should I say the embrace) of the SAP stack and non-SAP platforms (like Microsoft Azure) has also gained attention. With this post I would like to dig into one possi...
